intro: Perezia rigida var. acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-tipped perezia, is a rare and striking member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, glossy leaves that are often adorned with distinctive markings. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to red, which bloom in late spring. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in cool, humid environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in specialized botanical gardens.
